original: @151a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @151a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shat bhu dza shu kl'a t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: shat bhu dza shu kl'a t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Ṣaḍbhujaśuklātaḍāgādhānaṃ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: sgrol ma dkar mo phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: sgrol ma dkar mo phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: Six-handed White Tara Sādhana🔽

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Noble Tara!🔽

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid bsgoms te /
translated: Likewise, you should meditate on emptiness.🔽

original: de nas ram yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig las sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i ra ba la sogs pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ram yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig las sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i ra ba la sogs pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the transformation of the syllable RAM, upon the sun, from the syllable HUM, a variegated vajra arises, which transforms into the vajra fence and so forth.🔽

original: de'i dbus su pam yig las skyes pa'i padma'i steng du aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la h'um yig dkar po las skyes pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i autpa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su pam yig las skyes pa'i padma'i steng du aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la h'um yig dkar po las skyes pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i autpa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, on a lotus born from a paṃ syllable, on a moon born from an aṃ syllable, one should see a white utpala born from a white hūṃ syllable together with a seed.

original: de la spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma dkar mo zhal gsum phyag drug pa ser po dang sngon po ni g-yas dang cig shos kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: de la spro ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma dkar mo zhal gsum phyag drug pa ser po dang sngon po ni g-yas dang cig shos kyi zhal lo //
translated: Having first generated enthusiasm and so forth, from that transformation is the Blessed Lady White Tārā, with three faces—yellow, blue, and the right and left faces—and six arms.

original: zhal so so la spyan gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: zhal so so la spyan gsum gsum mo //
translated: Each face has three eyes.

original: mchog sbyin dang / bgrang phreng dang / mda' bsnams pa ni g-yas kyi phyag gsum mo //
analyzed: mchog sbyin dang / bgrang phreng dang / mda' bsnams pa ni g-yas kyi phyag gsum mo //
translated: The three right hands hold a boon-granting gesture, a rosary, and an arrow.

original: autpal dang / padma dang / gzhu bsnams pa ni g-yon gyi phyag gsum mo //
analyzed: autpal dang / padma dang / gzhu bsnams pa ni g-yon gyi phyag gsum mo //
translated: The three left hands hold an utpala, a lotus, and a bow.

original: skyil krung phyed pas zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa zla ba'i 'od lta bu /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa zla ba'i 'od lta bu /
translated: She stands in half-lotus posture on a moon seat, with a moon-like radiance.

original: ral pa'i thor tshugs la bzhugs pa'i don yod grub pa'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: ral pa'i thor tshugs la bzhugs pa'i don yod grub pa'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: Her hair is bound in a topknot, and she has the head ornament of Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbu la thod pa lngas rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu la thod pa lngas rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: Her head is adorned with five skulls.

original: zla ba phyed pas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: zla ba phyed pas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with a half-moon.

original: rgyan sna tshogs 'chang ba /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs 'chang ba /
translated: She wears various ornaments.

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa lta bu /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa lta bu /
translated: She is like a sixteen-year-old.

original: dur khrod brgyad kyi dbus na bzhugs pa /
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad kyi dbus na bzhugs pa /
translated: She stands in the center of the eight charnel grounds.

original: snying ga'i zla ba la gnas pa'i sa bon las bdag nyid bsams te /
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba la gnas pa'i sa bon las bdag nyid bsams te /
translated: Having visualized oneself as Vajrasattva, one should visualize the seed syllable on the moon at the heart.🔽

original: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized oneself as Tārā, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom aa tsa le aa ni mitta ba re h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom aa tsa le aa ni mitta ba re h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
translated: Om Acale Animiṣavare Hum Hum Phat Phat Svāhā.

original: smyung gnas dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas thun mtshams bzhir zla ba gcig tu bzlas pas zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smyung gnas dang mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas thun mtshams bzhir zla ba gcig tu bzlas pas zhi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having fasted and made offerings beforehand, one should recite for one month in four sessions. One will achieve pacification and so forth.

original: sgrol ma dkar mo phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgrol ma dkar mo phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of White Tārā with six arms is complete.
